title: Chebyshev's Weak Prime Number Theorem, Dirichlet's Theorem

blocks.name: chebbnd1lem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ chebbnd1 : show a lower bound on ` ppi ( x ) ` at even integers using similar techniques to those used to prove ~ bpos . (Note that the expression ` K ` is actually equal to ` 2 x. N ` , but proving that is not necessary for the proof, and it's too much work.) The key to the proof is ~ bposlem1 , which shows that each term in the expansion ` ( ( 2 x. N ) _C N ) = prod_ p e. Prime ` ` ( p ^ ( p pCnt ( ( 2 x. N ) _C N ) ) ) ` is at most ` 2 x. N ` , so that the sum really only has nonzero elements up to ` 2 x. N ` , and since each term is at most ` 2 x. N ` , after taking logs we get the inequality ` ppi ( 2 x. N ) x. log ( 2 x. N ) <_ ` ` log ( ( 2 x. N ) _C N ) ` , and ~ bclbnd finishes the proof. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: chebbnd1
blocks.content: The Chebyshev bound: The function ` ppi ( x ) ` is eventually lower bounded by a positive constant times ` x / log ( x ) ` . Alternatively stated, the function ` ( x / log ( x ) ) / ppi ( x ) ` is eventually bounded. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: chtppilim
blocks.content: The ` theta ` function is asymptotic to ` ppi ( x ) log ( x ) ` , so it is sufficient to prove ` theta ( x ) / x ~~>r 1 ` to establish the PNT. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: chebbnd2
blocks.content: The Chebyshev bound, part 2: The function ` ppi ( x ) ` is eventually upper bounded by a positive constant times ` x / log ( x ) ` . Alternatively stated, the function ` ppi ( x ) / ( x / log ( x ) ) ` is eventually bounded. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: chpchtlim
blocks.content: The ` psi ` and ` theta ` functions are asymptotic to each other, so is sufficient to prove either ` theta ( x ) / x ~~>r 1 ` or ` psi ( x ) / x ~~>r 1 ` to establish the PNT. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Apr-2016.)

  chpo1ub(s1)
  rehalfcld(cfv(cchp, cv(hs0)), wa(wtru, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat1, cle, cv(hs0)))))
  ltlecasei(cv(s1), nat2, wa(wa(wtru, wcel(cv(s1), crp)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(hs0)))), wbr(co(cfv(cchp, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1)), cle, co(cfv(cchp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, nat2)))
  eqbrtrd(co(cfv(cchp, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1)), cle, co(cfv(cchp, cv(hs0)), cdiv, nat2), co(nat0, cdiv, cv(s1)), wa(wa(wa(wtru, wcel(cv(s1), crp)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(hs0)))), wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat2)))

  biimpar(wa(wa(wtru, wcel(cv(s1), crp)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(hs0)))), wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat2), wceq(cfv(cchp, cv(s1)), nat0))
  syl(wa(wa(wtru, wcel(cv(s1), crp)), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wbr(nat1, cle, cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(hs0)))), wb(wceq(cfv(cchp, cv(s1)), nat0), wbr(cv(s1), clt, nat2)), wcel(cv(s1), cr))

  mptru(∃(s0 ∈ ℝ+, ∀(s1 ∈ ℝ+,((ψ ` s1)[÷]s1)[≤]s0)))
  lo1bddrp(s0, s1, hs0, crp, ((ψ ` s1)[÷]s1), nat1, ((ψ ` hs0)[÷]2), wtru)

  ltlecasei(s1, nat2, ((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+)∧((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0)), ((ψ ` s1)[÷]s1)[≤]((ψ ` hs0)[÷]2))
  eqbrtrd(((ψ ` s1)[÷]s1), cle, ((ψ ` hs0)[÷]2), (0[÷]s1), (((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+)∧((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0))∧ s1[<]2))

  biimpar(((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+)∧((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0)), s1[<]2, (ψ ` s1)= 0)
  syl(((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+)∧((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0)), ((ψ ` s1)= 0 ↔ s1[<]2), s1 ∈ ℝ)
  chpeq0(s1)

  chpge0(hs0)
  lediv12ad((ψ ` s1), s1, (ψ ` hs0), nat2, (((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+)∧((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0))∧ 2[≤]s1))
  ad2antrr((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+), ((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0), 2[≤]s1, (ψ ` s1)∈ ℝ)

  ltled(s1, hs0, ((T ∧ s1 ∈ ℝ+)∧((hs0 ∈ ℝ ∧ 1[≤]hs0)∧ s1[<]hs0)))

blocks.name: vmadivsum
blocks.content: The sum of the von Mangoldt function over ` n ` is asymptotic to ` log x + O(1) ` . Equation 9.2.13 of [Shapiro], p. 331. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Apr-2016.)

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  eqeltrri(cmpt(s0, crp, co(csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), co(cfv(cvma, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1))), cmin, cfv(clog, cv(s0)))), co1, co(cmpt(s0, crp, co(csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), co(cfv(cvma, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1))), cmin, co(cfv(clog, cfv(cfa, cfv(cfl, cv(s0)))), cdiv, cv(s0)))), cof(cmin), cmpt(s0, crp, co(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), cmin, co(cfv(clog, cfv(cfa, cfv(cfl, cv(s0)))), cdiv, cv(s0))))))

blocks.name: vmadivsumb
blocks.content: Give a total bound on the von Mangoldt sum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: rpvmasumlem

} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, crp, co(csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), co(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cmul, co(cfv(cvma, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1)))), cmin, cfv(clog, cv(s0)))), co1)), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, crp, co(csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), co(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cmul, co(cfv(cvma, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1)))), cmin, cfv(clog, cv(s0)))), co1)), diffsc(s0, c1))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, crp, co(csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), co(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cmul, co(cfv(cvma, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1)))), cmin, cfv(clog, cv(s0)))), co1)), diffsc(s0, c2))

blocks.name: dchrisum
blocks.content: If ` n e. [ M , +oo ) |-> A ( n ) ` is a positive decreasing function approaching zero, then the infinite sum ` sum_ n , X ( n ) A ( n ) ` is convergent, with the partial sum ` sum_ n <_ x , X ( n ) A ( n ) ` within ` O ( A ( M ) ) ` of the limit ` T ` . Lemma 9.4.1 of [Shapiro], p. 377. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dchrmusum2
blocks.content: The sum of the Möbius function multiplied by a non-principal Dirichlet character, divided by ` n ` , is bounded, provided that ` T =/= 0 ` . Lemma 9.4.2 of [Shapiro], p. 380. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-May-2016.)

blocks.content: Give an expression for ` log x ` remarkably similar to ` sum_ n <_ x ( X ( n ) Lam ( n ) / n ) ` given in ~ dchrvmasumlem1 . Part of Lemma 9.4.3 of [Shapiro], p. 380. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dchrvmasumlema
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ dchrvmasum and ~ dchrvmasumif . Apply ~ dchrisum for the function ` log ( y ) / y ` , which is decreasing above ` _e ` (or above 3, the nearest integer bound). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dchrvmasumif
blocks.content: An asymptotic approximation for the sum of ` X ( n ) Lam ( n ) / n ` conditional on the value of the infinite sum ` S ` . (We will later show that the case ` S = 0 ` is impossible, and hence establish ~ dchrvmasum .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dchrisum0flb

blocks.name: dchrisum0fno1

blocks.name: rpvmasum2
blocks.content: A partial result along the lines of ~ rpvmasum . The sum of the von Mangoldt function over those integers ` n == A ` (mod ` N ` ) is asymptotic to ` ( 1 - M ) ( log x / phi ( x ) ) + O(1) ` , where ` M ` is the number of non-principal Dirichlet characters with ` sum_ n e. NN , X ( n ) / n = 0 ` . Our goal is to show this set is empty. Equation 9.4.3 of [Shapiro], p. 375. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dchrisum0re
blocks.content: Suppose ` X ` is a non-principal Dirichlet character with ` sum_ n e. NN , X ( n ) / n = 0 ` . Then ` X ` is a real character. Part of Lemma 9.4.4 of [Shapiro], p. 382. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: dchrisum0
blocks.content: The sum ` sum_ n e. NN , X ( n ) / n ` is nonzero for all non-principal Dirichlet characters (i.e. the assumption ` X e. W ` is contradictory). This is the key result that allows us to eliminate the conditionals from ~ dchrmusum2 and ~ dchrvmasumif . Lemma 9.4.4 of [Shapiro], p. 382. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)

blocks.name: dchrisumn0
blocks.content: The sum ` sum_ n e. NN , X ( n ) / n ` is nonzero for all non-principal Dirichlet characters (i.e. the assumption ` X e. W ` is contradictory). This is the key result that allows us to eliminate the conditionals from ~ dchrmusum2 and ~ dchrvmasumif . Lemma 9.4.4 of [Shapiro], p. 382. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm dchrisumn0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wne(c0, nat0))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(czn, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(czrh, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cn))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cdchr, c2))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c7, c6))
  -| wceq(c8, cmpt(s0, cn, co(cfv(c7, cfv(c3, cv(s0))), cdiv, cv(s0))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c9, co(nat0, cico, cpnf)))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(cseq(nat1, caddc, c8), cli, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s1, co(nat1, cico, cpnf), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(cseq(nat1, caddc, c8), cfv(cfl, cv(s1))), cmin, c0)), cle, co(c9, cdiv, cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c8)
  -| diffsc(s1, c9)
} = {
  neqned(c0, nat0, w0)
  imnani(w0, wceq(c0, nat0))
  dchrisum0(s1, hs0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, crab(s1, cdif(c5, csn(c6)), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0)), c7, wa(w0, wceq(c0, nat0)))
  adantr(w0, wceq(c0, nat0), wcel(c2, cn))
  biimpar(w0, wceq(c0, nat0), wcel(c7, crab(s1, cdif(c5, csn(c6)), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0))))
  dchrvmaeq0(s0, s1, hs0, c7, crab(s1, cdif(c5, csn(c6)), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0)), c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c8, c9, w0)
  eqid(crab(s1, cdif(c5, csn(c6)), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0)))
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)

thm dchrisumn0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ≠ 0)
  ⊣ c1 =(Z/nZ ` c2)
  ⊣ c3 =(ZRHom ` c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ ℕ)
  ⊣ c4 =(DChr ` c2)
  ⊣ c5 =(Base ` c4)
  ⊣ c6 =(0 ` c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ∈ c5)
  ⊣ (w0 → c7 ≠ c6)
  ⊣ c8 =(s0 ∈ ℕ ↦((c7 `(c3 ` s0))[÷]s0))
  ⊣ (w0 → c9 ∈(0[[,)]+∞))
  ⊣ (w0 → seq(1(+, c8))[~~>]c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → ∀(s1 ∈(1[[,)]+∞),(abs `((seq(1(+, c8))`(⌊ ` s1))[-]c0))[≤](c9[÷]s1)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c7)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c7)
  ⊣ d(s1, c8)
  ⊣ d(s1, c9)
} = {
  neqned(c0, nat0, w0)
  imnani(w0, c0 = 0)
  dchrisum0(s1, hs0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, { s1 ∈(c5 \ { c6 })| sum(hs0 ∈ ℕ,((s1 `(c3 ` hs0))[÷]hs0))= 0 }, c7, (w0 ∧ c0 = 0))
  adantr(w0, c0 = 0, c2 ∈ ℕ)
  biimpar(w0, c0 = 0, c7 ∈ { s1 ∈(c5 \ { c6 })| sum(hs0 ∈ ℕ,((s1 `(c3 ` hs0))[÷]hs0))= 0 })
  dchrvmaeq0(s0, s1, hs0, c7, { s1 ∈(c5 \ { c6 })| sum(hs0 ∈ ℕ,((s1 `(c3 ` hs0))[÷]hs0))= 0 }, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c8, c9, w0)
  eqid({ s1 ∈(c5 \ { c6 })| sum(hs0 ∈ ℕ,((s1 `(c3 ` hs0))[÷]hs0))= 0 })
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c5)
  diff.hs0.c(c6)
  diff.hs0.c(c7)
  diff.hs0.w((w0 ∧ c0 = 0))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.c(c9)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c8)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: dchrmusumlem
blocks.content: The sum of the Möbius function multiplied by a non-principal Dirichlet character, divided by ` n ` , is bounded. Equation 9.4.16 of [Shapiro], p. 379. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(czn, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(czrh, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cn))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cdchr, c3))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c0, c6))

  -| wi(w0, wbr(cseq(nat1, caddc, c7), cli, c9))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s3, co(nat1, cico, cpnf), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(cfv(cseq(nat1, caddc, c7), cfv(cfl, cv(s3))), cmin, c9)), cle, co(c8, cdiv, cv(s3)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffss(s0, s3)

  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, crp, csu(s1, co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), co(cfv(c0, cfv(c1, cv(s1))), cmul, co(cfv(cmu, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1))))), co1)), diffsc(s1, c5))

blocks.name: dchrvmasum
blocks.content: The sum of the von Mangoldt function multiplied by a non-principal Dirichlet character, divided by ` n ` , is bounded. Equation 9.4.8 of [Shapiro], p. 376. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: rpvmasum
blocks.content: The sum of the von Mangoldt function over those integers ` n == A ` (mod ` N ` ) is asymptotic to ` log x / phi ( x ) + O(1) ` . Equation 9.4.3 of [Shapiro], p. 375. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 26-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(czn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(czrh, c2))

  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cui, c2))

  eqtrd(co(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), cmul, co(nat1, cmin, cfv(chash, crab(hs1, cdif(cfv(cbs, cfv(cdchr, c0)), csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(cdchr, c0)))), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(hs1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0))))), cfv(clog, cv(s0)), co(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), cmul, nat1), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), crp)))

  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), crp), wceq(co(nat1, cmin, cfv(chash, crab(hs1, cdif(cfv(cbs, cfv(cdchr, c0)), csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(cdchr, c0)))), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(hs1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0)))), nat1))

  syl6eq(cfv(chash, crab(hs1, cdif(cfv(cbs, cfv(cdchr, c0)), csn(cfv(c0g, cfv(cdchr, c0)))), wceq(csu(hs0, cn, co(cfv(cv(hs1), cfv(c3, cv(hs0))), cdiv, cv(hs0))), nat0))), nat0, cfv(chash, emptycls), w0)

  hash0()
  1m0e1()
  mulid1d(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), crp)))
  recnd(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), crp)))
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(s0), crp), wcel(cfv(clog, cv(s0)), cr))

blocks.name: rplogsum
blocks.content: The sum of ` log p / p ` over the primes ` p == A ` (mod ` N ` ) is asymptotic to ` log x / phi ( x ) + O(1) ` . Equation 9.4.3 of [Shapiro], p. 375. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm rplogsum(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cmpt(s0, crp, co(co(cfv(cphi, c0), cmul, csu(s1, cin(co(nat1, cfz, cfv(cfl, cv(s0))), cin(cprime, c1)), co(cfv(clog, cv(s1)), cdiv, cv(s1)))), cmin, cfv(clog, cv(s0)))), co1))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(czn, c0))

blocks.name: dirith2
blocks.content: Dirichlet's theorem: there are infinitely many primes in any arithmetic progression coprime to ` N ` . Theorem 9.4.1 of [Shapiro], p. 375. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2016.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 26-May-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: dirith
blocks.content: Dirichlet's theorem: there are infinitely many primes in any arithmetic progression coprime to ` N ` . Theorem 9.4.1 of [Shapiro], p. 375. See ~ http://metamath-blog.blogspot.com/2016/05/dirichlets-theorem.html for an informal exposition. This is Metamath 100 proof #48. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-May-2016.)

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)

} = {
  eqbrtrrd(crab(s0, cprime, wbr(c0, cdvds, co(cv(s0), cmin, c1))), cen, cn, cin(cprime, cima(ccnv(cfv(czrh, cfv(czn, c0))), csn(cfv(cfv(czrh, cfv(czn, c0)), c1)))), w3a(wcel(c0, cn), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)))
